intro: Prunus fruticosa f. dubia, commonly known as the wild cherry shrub, is a compact, deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features small, ovate leaves that are dark green on top and pale underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by dark red to black berries in the fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is adapted to a variety of soil types, making it a hardy and versatile plant. Its ornamental value comes from its foliage, flowers, and berries, which attract birds and provide ecological benefits.
